name: KPI Grid
description: Multi-column grid layout displaying 3-6 key performance indicators with large display numbers and compact captions, ideal for dashboards and report summaries requiring at-a-glance metric scanning.
components: KPI card (repeated 3-6 times): self-contained metric unit
Metric value: $display-01 for the primary number, $text-01 color
Metric unit: $label-01 inline or superscript for unit/suffix (%, USD, etc.)
Metric caption: $label-01 in $text-03 below the number describing the KPI
Optional trend indicator: $label-01 with directional arrow + $green-60 (up) or $red-60 (down)
Optional g10 card background for each KPI unit
rules: Maximum 6 KPIs — more than 6 on one grid loses scannability; split into two grids if needed
Optimal count is 3-4 KPIs for A4; use 4/4/4/4 (4-col) or 5/5/6 (3-col) internal sub-grid
Metric value uses $display-01 — this is the largest element in the grid and the primary visual anchor
Caption uses $label-01 in $text-03 — de-emphasized but readable, max 3 words
Use g10 theme for the entire grid to create visual separation from surrounding content
Internal spacing between KPI cards is $spacing-05 (16px) — tight enough to read as a group
Each KPI card has $spacing-05 internal padding and optional $ui-03 bottom border
Trend indicators (if present) use $green-60 for positive and $red-60 for negative trends

printBehavior.pagePosition: flexible — often near executive summary or dashboard sections
printBehavior.bleedHandling: g10 background extends to column edges, not to trim

accessibilityNotes: Each KPI card should use aria-label combining the metric value and caption (e.g., aria-label='Revenue: 4.2 billion dollars')
Trend indicators must include text alternatives — arrow direction + color is not enough for screen readers
Use <dl> (definition list) markup: <dt> for caption, <dd> for value — semantically correct for key-value pairs
g10 background must maintain WCAG AA contrast (4.5:1) with all text tokens used within
antiPatterns: Never exceed 6 KPIs in a single grid — cognitive overload makes metrics unreadable at a glance
Never use body typography ($body-long-01, $body-short-01) for metric values — $display-01 scale is required
Never use an 8/8 two-column grid for KPIs — minimum 3 columns to justify using this pattern over inline stats
Never place two KPI grids on the same page — one grid per page or spread maximum
Never include descriptive paragraphs inside KPI cards — captions are 3 words max; use adjacent RichText for context
